column4: hey, been trying to install my video drivers all night, using a gtx285, can anyone help me out here?
can anyone help me out with getting my video cards drivers working?
..can someone help me setup my video cards drivers? been trying for a while, not working. have 1 nvidia gtx285, tried off of the nvidia website, with envyng, nothing =s
could someone help me out with video drivers, have been trying for a while now. using a nvidia gtx 285

could someone help me out with video drivers, have been trying for a while now. using a nvidia gtx 285.. tried with EnvyNG and the official download off of nvidias site but nothing seems to be working.. =s

could someone help me out with video drivers, have been trying for a while now. using a nvidia gtx 285.. tried with EnvyNG and the official download off of nvidias site but nothing seems to be working.. =s
by not installing what kind of error do you get

it doesnt give an error really. it just doesnt do anything. with envyng it just gets stuck at 71% for installing the drivers and freezes up. off of the official sites download it says to terminate x server or something, i looked into it and.. probably did something wrong, because it didnt go well.
to install the driver from nvidia you need to go into a terminal crtl + alt + f1 then sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop then run the installer
sorry that is how you get into the terminal
yea pretty bad about this. that is the same terminal as applications>accessories>terminal, right?
well ctrl-alt-f1 doesnt seem to be.. doing anything, as far as i see at least
should i be seeing something when i hit Ctrl+alt+f1?
reboot into rescue mode then run the installer
will i still need to run sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop or just run the installer?
